Guys- i just found out that not only is a Dub being made for Ascendance of a bookworm- episode 1 dub is already out-
which is crazy because 3 days ago i searched to see if it was even getting a dub and the answer i got was "NO"
sounds like I have a new anime to watch for
it's not a super exciting show- but it is a lot of fun- cute, and has a ton of world building that keeps it interesting
i was so interested by the first episode that i ended up buying all the current books and read them in a few days
Iirc, that's the one where the girl goes to another world and ends up in medieval times with almost no books and she happens to be a bookeorr?
the girl dies from an earthquake and gets crushed by book at a library she just started working at
and she was reincarnated into the body of a 5 year old
I think the closest I've ever come to watching one of those is Escaflowne like 15 years ago....
the body shes reincarnated into or transferred to is also terminally ill
Ughhhh, that's a hardcore nope for me then.
I'm a pretty desensitized dude, but sick and dying children gets me something fierce.
her illness is magic that builds up in her system and kills her since she doesnt have magical items to help her release the mana from her body
so it just builds up till- pop
There was an ad campaign a few years back that was brutal with that stuff. From an airline of all places.
so she has a terminal illness that has a "Cure"
i highly recommend giving it a shot

Where they were partnering with a children's hospital and Google or something to put these terminal kids inside projector cubes that were hooked up to a 360° camera out in the field doing their dream job so that the kids could come close to having that
Fucking made me bawl damn near uncontrollably at work the first time I saw that.
this is a very feel good anime
Oof. I mean, still a maybe my dude. Gotta finish Breaking Bad first.
But I'll try to find the time to give it a watch.
Feel good animes are kinda iffy with me as well. Like that dragon pilot anime in Netflix.
I thought watching 1080p anime on my new 4k tv (that i got cheap because- if i didnt i would be able to get one) would be a bad experience but- it's actually looking great
the up-scaling tech has gotten waaaay better
Got a ton of recommendations as "such a great feel good anime" and I couldn't get past like the fourth episode it was so... Empty.
sometimes there is quite a border

Dragon Pilot, I remember that. First episode or two were interesting, then I lost interest

I dont really watch much anime, as most of them seem very derivative. Like someone already invented Generational Neural Nets 20 years ago and started churning out anime thats just a remix of other anime
but i think we still get 1 or 2 really good and watchable animes a year
To be fair, if anything feels derivative its because art inspires art
Look at classical paintings.  Some artists literally ripped off other artists.
I'm trying to remember the two paintings in question.  The one took the pose of a background character and copied it as one of the main subjects in the foreground of their work
